subject: p19075045
History: Year old man with MRSA bacteremia, cardiogenic shock, pulm HTN, placement.
Impression: Swan-Ganz catheter tip appears to be in the more distal aspect of the right main pulmonary artery. There are persistent low lung volumes. Moderate cardiomegaly is stable. Pacer leads are in standard position. There is no pneumothorax. If any there is small left effusion. Bibasilar opacities have minimally improved. Right perihilar opacity has almost completely resolved.
